results.headline: Doomed Blond Bombshell Not Really Included

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jayne Mansfield's Car

results.summary_short: “Jayne Mansfield’s Car” is a family drama that, despite its name, isn’t about the actress who died young in a car accident in the late 1960s.

results.headline: Loveless Marriage on a Lovely Island

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of And While We Were Here

results.summary_short: “And While We Were Here,” a drama set in Ischia, Italy, follows a couple and a stranger who enters their lives.

results.headline: Revealing a Subject Who Holds Back

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Harry Dean Stanton: Partly Fiction

results.summary_short: The actor Harry Dean Stanton, 87, is guarded in the extreme, but Sophie Huber’s documentary film aims to find his depths.

results.headline: A Fashionable Attempt, Whimsy Included

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mademoiselle C

results.summary_short: As one person says in the documentary “Mademoiselle C,” Carine Roitfeld, the 58-year-old former editor of French Vogue, is “the sexiest girl in fashion.”

results.headline: Redefining Bollywood Love Stories

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shuddh Desi Romance

results.summary_short: In “Shuddh Desi Romance,” an unsure groom makes for an interesting wedding ceremony.

results.headline: Two Orphans Wonder, What Now?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Future

results.summary_short: The grieving teenagers of “Il Futuro” seek security in the care of some shady men and a love affair with a recluse.

results.headline: Preparing Autistic Pupils to Face the World

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Best Kept Secret

results.summary_short: The documentary “Best Kept Secret,” by Samantha Buck, follows a teacher at the John F. Kennedy High School in Newark and her class of young men with autism.

results.headline: The Protest in the Park
results.display_title: 99% - The Occupy Wall Street Collaborative Film

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 99% - The Occupy Wall Street Collaborative Film

results.summary_short: The documentary “99%” is more than a vivid, you-are-there record of a gathering of idealists in Zuccotti Park in New York; it outlines the issues that gave birth to a movement.

results.headline: Love in a Time of Quarantine

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Flu

results.summary_short: A rescue worker falls in love with a virologist and single mother during a devastating outbreak of avian flu in the Korean disaster film “Flu.”

results.headline: A South African Heroine, With the Flaws Air-Brushed

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Winnie

results.summary_short: Darrell J. Roodt’s biopic “Winnie Mandela” is a sanitized dash through a life of fortitude and controversy.

results.headline: A Stripped-Down Strongman for Our Times

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Riddick

results.summary_short: The title character of “Riddick” undergoes a rebirth of sorts in this latest film in the series.

results.headline: A Delicate Balance Tested

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Touchy Feely

results.summary_short: “Touchy Feely” centers on two adult siblings dealing with unexpected upheaval.

results.headline: A Billionaire’s Story

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Ultimate Life

results.summary_short: “The Ultimate Life,” a follow-up to “The Ultimate Gift,” is about the billionaire oilman Red Stevens and the life lessons he wants pass on to his grandson.

results.headline: The Punishment for Being Publicity-Shy

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Salinger

results.summary_short: The documentary “Salinger,” about the author of “The Catcher in the Rye,” seeks to tear down the fortress of privacy he erected around his life.

results.headline: China’s Assault on Bordeaux

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Red Obsession

results.summary_short: China has become the biggest importer of wines from Bordeaux, and the documentary “Red Obsession” looks at the tension this has generated in the clubby French wine scene.

results.headline: Secretary, Take a Letter, and Be Sure to Type It Fast

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Populaire

results.summary_short: The French film “Populaire,” set in the late 1950s, recalls the romantic comedies of Doris Day and Rock Hudson.

results.headline: Strong Enough to Laugh

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Am Breathing

results.summary_short: “I Am Breathing” delicately chronicles the final months of Neil Platt, a resilient young Scotsman stricken with Lou Gehrig’s disease.

results.headline: The C.E.O. at the Center of a Catastrophe
results.display_title: Out of the Clear Blue Sky

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Out of the Clear Blue Sky

results.summary_short: Out of the Clear Blue Sky” is Danielle Gardner’s documentary about the Sept. 11 destruction and subsequent rebirth of the investment firm Cantor Fitzgerald.

results.headline: A Bad Mix: A Father, a Son and a Star
results.display_title: My Father and the Man in Black

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Father and the Man in Black

results.summary_short: “My Father and the Man in Black,” about Johnny Cash, his onetime manager Saul Holiff and the black dog of depression, was made by Jonathan Holiff.

results.headline: Childhood Friends, Torn Apart by Ambitions

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mission Park

results.summary_short: “Mission Park,” directed by Bryan Anthony Ramirez, is about four childhood friends whose ambitions land them on opposite sides of the law.
